com.milk.util
Class EqComparator

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.util.EqComparator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparator
public final class EqComparator
extends java.lang.Object
implements Comparator

This is a comparator which uses == to perform comparisons and System.identityHashCode() as the compare-hash. The class is named after the Lisp concept of eq, which is approximately its version of ==.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

Method Detail

compareEquals

public boolean compareEquals(java.lang.Object obj1,
                             java.lang.Object obj2)
Return true if this Comparator considers the given two objects to be equal. In this case, it only returns true if obj1 == obj2.

Specified by:
compareEquals in interface Comparator
Parameters:
obj1 - the first object
obj2 - the second object
Returns:
the result of comparison

compareHash

public int compareHash(java.lang.Object obj)
Get the compare-hash for the given object. In this case, it returns System.identityHashCode(obj).

Specified by:
compareHash in interface Comparator
Parameters:
obj - the object to figure the hash of
Returns:
the compare-hash of the object
